metadata.title: CVE-2016-6207 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the _gdContributionsAlloc function ingd_interpolation.c in GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory writeor memory consumption) via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3').
